Row.Text: Tier 1 Antiquity Ranged Unit. Stronger on attack than defense.
Tier 2 Antiquity Ranged Unit. Stronger on attack than defense.
Tier 2 Antiquity Cavalry Unit. Ignores Zone of Control.
Tier 2 Antiquity Siege Unit. High Bombard strength for attacking [icon:CITY_FORTIFIED] Fortified Districts.
Tier 3 Antiquity Cavalry Unit. Ignores Zone of Control.
Combat bonus when making an unobstructed attack from more than one tile away.
Aksumite Unique Naval Unit. +4 [icon:NAR_REW_COMBAT] Combat Strength on Coast. Can cross borders of other Civilizations, and has 1 charge to create a [icon:TRADE_ROUTE] Trade Route.
Tier 2 Aksumite Unique Naval Unit. +4 [icon:NAR_REW_COMBAT] Combat Strength on Coast. Can cross borders of other Civilizations, and has 1 charge to create a [icon:TRADE_ROUTE] Trade Route.
Tier 3 Aksumite Unique Naval Unit. +4 [icon:NAR_REW_COMBAT] Combat Strength on Coast. Can cross borders of other Civilizations, and has 1 charge to create a [icon:TRADE_ROUTE] Trade Route.
Aksumite Unique Trade Ship. Cannot be pillaged. +10 [icon:TRADE_ROUTE] Trade Route range. +2 [icon:YIELD_GOLD] Gold from this [icon:TRADE_ROUTE] Trade Route.
Egyptian Unique Infantry Unit. Has no Maintenance. +3 [icon:NAR_REW_COMBAT] Combat Strength in friendly territory, doubled when stationed in a Settlement you own.
Tier 1 Egyptian Unique Infantry Unit. Has no Maintenance. +3 [icon:NAR_REW_COMBAT] Combat Strength in friendly territory, doubled when stationed in a Settlement you own.
Tier 2 Egyptian Unique Infantry Unit. Has no Maintenance. +3 [icon:NAR_REW_COMBAT] Combat Strength in friendly territory, doubled when stationed in a Settlement you own.
Tier 3 Egyptian Unique Infantry Unit. Has no Maintenance. +3 [icon:NAR_REW_COMBAT] Combat Strength in friendly territory, doubled when stationed in a Settlement you own.
+{1_Amount} Combat Strength in friendly territory, doubled when stationed in a Settlement you own.
Greek Unique Infantry Unit. +2 [icon:NAR_REW_COMBAT] Combat Strength if adjacent to another [icon:UNIT_HOPLITE] Hoplite.
Tier 1 Greek Unique Infantry Unit. +2 [icon:NAR_REW_COMBAT] Combat Strength if adjacent to another [icon:UNIT_HOPLITE] Hoplite.
Tier 2 Greek Unique Infantry Unit. +2 [icon:NAR_REW_COMBAT] Combat Strength if adjacent to another [icon:UNIT_HOPLITE] Hoplite.
Tier 3 Greek Unique Infantry Unit. +2 [icon:NAR_REW_COMBAT] Combat Strength if adjacent to another [icon:UNIT_HOPLITE] Hoplite.
+2 [icon:NAR_REW_COMBAT] Combat Strength if adjacent to another [icon:UNIT_HOPLITE] Hoplite.
+1 [icon:NAR_REW_COMBAT] Combat Strength for each [icon:CITYSTATE] City-State you are suzerain of.
Han Unique Ranged Unit. Has Zone of Control and a higher Defense Strength. +5 [icon:Action_Ranged] Combat Strength when attacking adjacent Units.
Tier 1 Han Unique Ranged Unit. Has Zone of Control and a higher Defense Strength. +5 [icon:Action_Ranged] Combat Strength when attacking adjacent Units.
Tier 2 Han Unique Ranged Unit. Has Zone of Control and a higher Defense Strength. +5 [icon:Action_Ranged] Combat Strength when attacking adjacent Units.
Khmer Unique Cavalry Unit. Higher Combat Strength, but slower [icon:Action_Move] Movement. Immune to flood damage. Ignores Zone of Control.
Tier 2 Khmer Unique Cavalry Unit. Higher Combat Strength, but slower [icon:Action_Move] Movement. Immune to flood damage. Ignores Zone of Control.
Tier 3 Khmer Unique Cavalry Unit. Higher Combat Strength, but slower [icon:Action_Move] Movement. Immune to flood damage. Ignores Zone of Control.

Khmer Unique Merchant. Civilian who can establish a [icon:TRADE_ROUTE] Trade Route to import [icon:RADIAL_RESOURCES] Resources from a foreign Settlement. Immune to flood damage. Ignores [icon:Action_Move] Movement penalties from Wet Terrain.
Maurya Unique Cavalry Unit. +5 [icon:NAR_REW_COMBAT] Combat Strength against [icon:CITY_FORTIFIED] Fortified Districts. Ignores Zone of Control.
Tier 2 Maurya Unique Cavalry Unit. +5 [icon:NAR_REW_COMBAT] Combat Strength against [icon:CITY_FORTIFIED] Fortified Districts. Ignores Zone of Control.
Tier 3 Maurya Unique Cavalry Unit. +5 [icon:NAR_REW_COMBAT] Combat Strength against [icon:CITY_FORTIFIED] Fortified Districts. Ignores Zone of Control.
Maurya Unique Settler. Civilian Unit capable of founding new [icon:YIELD_TOWNS] Towns. Adds +2[icon:YIELD_HAPPINESS] Happiness on City Halls.
Maya Unique Ranged Unit. Can see through Vegetation, and [icon:CITY_UNIMPROVED] Vegetated Terrain does not end their [icon:Action_Move] Movement.
Tier 1 Maya Unique Ranged Unit. Can see through Vegetation, and [icon:CITY_UNIMPROVED] Vegetated Terrain does not end their [icon:Action_Move] Movement.
Tier 2 Maya Unique Ranged Unit. Can see through Vegetation, and [icon:CITY_UNIMPROVED] Vegetated Terrain does not end their [icon:Action_Move] Movement.

Maya Unique Scout. Can initiate combat. Has 1 charge to place Jaguar Traps on [icon:CITY_UNIMPROVED] Flat or Vegetated Terrain. Traps are invisible to enemy Units, deal 25 [icon:DAMAGED] damage, and end [icon:Action_Move] Movement. This ability recharges 5 turns after placing a trap.

Deals 25 [icon:DAMAGED] damage to enemy Units that enter the tile and ends their [icon:Action_Move] Movement. This removes the trap. Traps are invisible to all other Civilizations until triggered. Can be placed in unowned territory. Must be placed on Flat or Vegetated Terrain.
Mississippian Unique Ranged Unit. Increased Bombard Strength. +3 [icon:Action_Ranged] Combat Strength against Siege Units. Applies the [icon:PLOT_BURNING] Burning status to tiles for 2 turns.
Tier 1 Mississippian Unique Ranged Unit. Increased Bombard Strength. +3 [icon:Action_Ranged] Combat Strength against Siege Units. Applies the [icon:PLOT_BURNING] Burning status to tiles for 2 turns.
Tier 2 Mississippian Unique Ranged Unit. Increased Bombard Strength. +3 [icon:Action_Ranged] Combat Strength against Siege Units. Applies the [icon:PLOT_BURNING] Burning status to tiles for 2 turns.

Mississippian Unique Merchant. Civilian who can establish a [icon:TRADE_ROUTE] Trade Route to import [icon:RADIAL_RESOURCES] Resources from a foreign Settlement. Gain 25[icon:YIELD_GOLD] Gold per [icon:RADIAL_RESOURCES] Resource acquired when creating a [icon:TRADE_ROUTE] Trade Route.
Achaemenid Persian Unique Infantry Unit. Heals 15 [icon:Action_Heal] HP after defeating an enemy Unit.
Tier 2 Achaemenid Persian Unique Infantry Unit. Heals 15 [icon:Action_Heal] HP after defeating an enemy Unit.
Tier 3 Achaemenid Persian Unique Infantry Unit. Heals 15 [icon:Action_Heal] HP after defeating an enemy Unit.
Heals 15 [icon:Action_Heal] HP after defeating an enemy Unit.
Achaemenid Persian Unique Army Commander. Starts with the [icon:NAR_REW_PROMOTION] Initiative Promotion.
Roman Unique Infantry Unit. +1 [icon:NAR_REW_COMBAT] Combat Strength for every [icon:TRADITION] Tradition in the [icon:GOVERNMENT] Government.
Tier 2 Roman Unique Infantry Unit. +1 [icon:NAR_REW_COMBAT] Combat Strength for every [icon:TRADITION] Tradition in the [icon:GOVERNMENT] Government.
Tier 3 Roman Unique Infantry Unit. +1 [icon:NAR_REW_COMBAT] Combat Strength for every [icon:TRADITION] Tradition in the [icon:GOVERNMENT] Government.
+1 [icon:NAR_REW_COMBAT] Combat Strength for every [icon:TRADITION] Tradition in the [icon:GOVERNMENT] Government.
Roman Unique Army Commander. Gains 1 charge to create a new [icon:YIELD_TOWNS] Town for every 3 [icon:NAR_REW_PROMOTION] Levels it has.
City-State Unique Infantry Unit. Up to 20% cheaper to purchase. Each one is slightly more expensive than the last. +2 [icon:NAR_REW_COMBAT] Combat Strength for each adjacent Military Unit.
Tier 1 City-State Unique Infantry Unit. Up to 20% cheaper to purchase. Each one is slightly more expensive than the last. +2 [icon:NAR_REW_COMBAT] Combat Strength for each adjacent Military Unit.
